The broom: balancing myth has grown to encompass days other than the equinox, based on the belief that a "gravitational pull" and/or a "planetary alignment" creates the right conditions for brooms to stand on their ends unsupported.
The expert explains that the broom: standing phenomenon has nothing to do with equinoxes or planetary alignments. Instead, it can be achieved with practice and patience by manipulating the broom's low center of gravity and spreading the bristles to create a tripod-like structure.
David Mikkelson: the founder of snopes.com, addressed the myth of egg balancing on the equinox back in 1999, indicating that it is related to the broom-balancing myth.
